How it's made

Concurrent version control

One of the first steps was to create a GIT repository, I like to control my versions and I love GIT! Using GIT every change will be tracked, and you will be able to jump backward whenever you want.

Web service

I developed, for this pourpose, a kind of C scripting web framework, this means that you can write your web application using C as script language. How this is possible?
I combined various software: a C copiler/interpreter TinyC developed by Fabrice Bellard (yes, is the Qemu author!), and Fossa a simple C network library. With these two tools I developed a web server that is capable to serve static contents (.html, .css, .js, etc.), RESTFUL API, and websocket stream.

Contents

All the contents of this web page are JSON documents, so if you don't like my web presentation you are able to use your custom interface and call my APIs :) Asynchronous calls, such as Ajax and websocket, are made using jQuery javascript framework. This web page uses Twitter Bootstrap as web site skeleton, so contents are almost styled using its class. There is also a custom CSS for the rest.
